required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Etanercept in Patients Treated Over the Long-term in Real-world Clinical Practice, Using Data Collected by the British Society of Rheumatology Biologics Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Etanercept in a UK Observational Cohort Study - a Retrospective Database Analysis of British Society of Rheumatology Biologics Registry (BSRBR) Data

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the rates of serious adverse events and death in adult rheumatoid arthritis patients treated with etanercept over the long-term in real-life clinical practice. It will also assess whether there is any difference in the rate of serious adverse events in patients trated with etanercept in comparision to patients treated with conventional disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARDs). The study will in addition quantify the efficacy of etanercept in this population by assessing the rates of important clinical outcomes such as changes in disease activity and disability/functioning.

detailed_description.textblock: patients recruited sequentially as seen in clinical practice

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
primary_outcome.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of the years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by mean follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of malignancy events divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000.

primary_outcome.measure: Crude Incidence Rate of Lymphoproliferative Malignancy (LM)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
primary_outcome.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by mean follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of LMs divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Lymphoproliferative: medical condition characterized by the dysfunction of the immune system often resulting in excessive production of lymphocytes. LMs included lymphoma, myeloma, and leukemia. Adverse outcome was defined as 'lymphoproliferative malignancy' in the field [lymphopro] labeled by BSRBR.

primary_outcome.measure: Crude Incidence Rate of Serious Infections
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
primary_outcome.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of the years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by total follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of serious infections divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Serious infections included those infections which required intravenous antibiotics, hospitalization, or resulted in death. Adverse outcome was defined as 'serious infection' in the field [serinf] labeled by BSRBR.

primary_outcome.measure: Crude Incidence Rate of Other Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
primary_outcome.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of the years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by total follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of other serious adverse events divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Other serious adverse events were based on classifications assigned by the BSRBR and included cardiac serious adverse events (SAEs), central nervous system SAEs, and nonmalignant hematological SAEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Crude Incidence Rate of All-Cause Mortality
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
primary_outcome.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of the years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by total follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of deaths divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Death was recorded in the adverse outcomes table and in the consultant follow-up table. Where multiple events described death for the same participant, date of death was taken as per the earliest record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Switched to Other Therapy Following Etanercept Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who switched from etanercept to either DMARDs or alternative biologic drug are reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time on etanercept therapy was calculated by Kaplan-Meier survival analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count (DAS28) at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from the number of swollen joints (SJC) and tender joints (TJC) using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (erythrocyte sedimentation rate [ESR, millimeter per hour] or C-reactive protein [CRP, milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a Visual Analog Scale [VAS] of 0 millimeter [mm]-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count (DAS28) at Year 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Remission and Low Disease Activity as Assessed by Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count (DAS28)
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity. Time to achieve remission was calculated by Kaplan-Meier survival analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: HAQ: self-reported, valid assessment of functional disability in rheumatoid arthritis. Assessed based on ability of participants to perform daily activities in 8 categories: dressing, arising, eating, walking, reaching, gripping, hygiene, and carrying out daily activities. HAQ score range: 0-3: without any difficulty=0, with some difficulty=1, with much difficulty=2, unable to do=3. HAQ total scores expressed as overall mean score with range 0-3: 0-0.25=normal functioning; 0.25-0.5=mild functional limitation; 0.5-1=moderate functional limitation; more than 1=significant functional limitation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score at Year 1, 2, and 3
secondary_outcome.description: HAQ: self-reported, valid assessment of functional disability in rheumatoid arthritis. Assessed based on ability of participants to perform daily activities in 8 categories: dressing, arising, eating, walking, reaching, gripping, hygiene, and carrying out daily activities. HAQ score range: 0-3: without any difficulty=0, with some difficulty=1, with much difficulty=2, unable to do=3. HAQ total scores expressed as overall mean score with range 0-3: 0-0.25=normal functioning; 0.25-0.5=mild functional limitation; 0.5-1=moderate functional limitation; more than 1=significant functional limitation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Remission Based on Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score
secondary_outcome.description: HAQ: self-reported, valid assessment of functional disability in rheumatoid arthritis. Assessed based on ability of participants to perform daily activities in 8 categories: dressing, arising, eating, walking, reaching, gripping, hygiene, and carrying out daily activities. HAQ score range: 0-3: without any difficulty=0, with some difficulty=1, with much difficulty=2, unable to do=3. HAQ total scores expressed as overall mean score with range 0-3. Participants who had HAQ total score <=0.5 were considered in remission state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score 6 Months Prior to And 6 Months Post-Switching Etanercept
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months prior to and 6 months post switching etanercept
secondary_outcome.description: HAQ: self-reported, valid assessment of functional disability in rheumatoid arthritis. Assessed based on ability of participants to perform daily activities in 8 categories: dressing, arising, eating, walking, reaching, gripping, hygiene, and carrying out daily activities. HAQ score range: 0-3: without any difficulty=0, with some difficulty=1, with much difficulty=2, unable to do=3. HAQ total scores expressed as overall mean score with range 0-3: 0-0.25=normal functioning; 0.25-0.5=mild functional limitation; 0.5-1=moderate functional limitation; more than 1=significant functional limitation.

arm_group.description: adult rheumatoid arthritis patients initiating therapy with etanercept as their first biologic therapy
biologic-naive adult rheumatoid arthritis patients with DAS28 >4.2 treated with non-biologic anti-rheumatic drugs(s).

intervention.description: use as per routine clinical practice
use as per routine clinical practice (methotrexate, azathioprine, cyclophosphamide, cyclosporine, leflunomide, other)

study_pop.textblock: adult patients with a diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult
- rheumatoid arthritis
- group 1: initiating etanercept as first biologic therapy
- group 2: DAS28<4.2, biologic naive and treated with non-biologic DMARDs
Exclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of other inflammatory arthritis

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Etanercept
group.description: Participants with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who received etanercept (ETN, as their first biological drug) in doses as per approved product label or summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed using the data in British Society for Rheumatology Biologics Register (BSRBR) for a maximum of 10 years. Doses of ETN and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity. Participants were eligible to receive any other therapy instead of ETN, as per investigator’s discretion and the doses of these were not controlled in the follow-up.

group.title: nbDMARDs
group.description: Biological naive participants with active RA who received non-biologic disease modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (nbDMARDs) in doses as per approved product label or SmPC were observed using the data in BSRBR for a maximum of 8.75 years. Doses of nbDMARDs and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

participants_list.participants: Completed refers to participants who continued up to last follow-up.
Completed refers to participants who continued up to last follow-up.

baseline.population: Safety analysis population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration.

group.title: Etanercept
group.description: Participants with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who received etanercept (ETN, as their first biological drug) in doses as per approved product label or summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed using the data in British Society for Rheumatology Biologics Register (BSRBR) for a maximum of 10 years. Doses of ETN and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity. Participants were eligible to receive any other therapy instead of ETN, as per investigator’s discretion and the doses of these were not controlled in the follow-up.

measure.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of the years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by mean follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of malignancy events divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000.

analysis.groups_desc: Cox proportional hazards model adjusted for age, baseline steroid, smoking history, previous cancer, and body mass index was used for analysis.

outcome.title: Crude Incidence Rate of Lymphoproliferative Malignancy (LM)
outcome.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by mean follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of LMs divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Lymphoproliferative: medical condition characterized by the dysfunction of the immune system often resulting in excessive production of lymphocytes. LMs included lymphoma, myeloma, and leukemia. Adverse outcome was defined as ‘lymphoproliferative malignancy’ in the field [lymphopro] labeled by BSRBR.

outcome.population: Safety analysis population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration.

Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of serious infections divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Serious infections included those infections which required intravenous antibiotics, hospitalization, or resulted in death. Adverse outcome was defined as ‘serious infection’ in the field [serinf] labeled by BSRBR.

group.title: Etanercept

measure.title: Crude Incidence Rate of Serious Infections
measure.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of the years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by total follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of serious infections divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Serious infections included those infections which required intravenous antibiotics, hospitalization, or resulted in death. Adverse outcome was defined as ‘serious infection’ in the field [serinf] labeled by BSRBR.
measure.population: Safety analysis population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration.

analysis.groups_desc: Cox proportional hazards model adjusted for age, gender, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, baseline DMARDs, methotrexate, disease activity score based on 28-joints count (DAS28), and smoking history was used for analysis.

outcome.title: Crude Incidence Rate of Other Serious Adverse Events
outcome.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of the years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by total follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of other serious adverse events divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Other serious adverse events were based on classifications assigned by the BSRBR and included cardiac serious adverse events (SAEs), central nervous system SAEs, and nonmalignant hematological SAEs.

outcome.population: Safety analysis population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration.

Other serious adverse events were based on classifications assigned by the BSRBR and included cardiac serious adverse events (SAEs), central nervous system SAEs, and nonmalignant hematological SAEs.

analysis.groups_desc: Cox proportional hazards model adjusted for age, gender, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, methotrexate, and baseline health assessment questionnaire (HAQ) score was used for analysis.

outcome.title: Crude Incidence Rate of All-Cause Mortality
outcome.description: Participant-Year estimated by calculating all of the years that participants in a study were followed (number of evaluable participants multiplied by total follow-up in years). Crude (unadjusted) incidence rate calculated as number of deaths divided by Participant-Year, multiplied by 1000. Death was recorded in the adverse outcomes table and in the consultant follow-up table. Where multiple events described death for the same participant, date of death was taken as per the earliest record.

analysis.groups_desc: Cox proportional hazards model adjusted for age, gender, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, methotrexate, baseline HAQ score, Charlson index, smoking history, and body mass index was used for analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Switched to Other Therapy Following Etanercept Discontinuation
outcome.description: Participants who switched from etanercept to either DMARDs or alternative biologic drug are reported.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
outcome.population: Full Analysis set (FAS) population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration. Only participants treated with ETN were to be analyzed for this outcome measure.

measure.population: FAS population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration. Only participants treated with ETN were to be analyzed for this outcome measure.

measure.population: FAS population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count (DAS28) at Year 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5
outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of 1 consultant follow-up after baseline registration. N (number of participants analyzed): participants evaluable for this measure, n: participants evaluable for specified time-points for each treatment arm, respectively.

group.title: Etanercept
group.description: Participants with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who received etanercept (ETN, as their first biological drug) in doses as per approved product label or summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed using the data in British Society for Rheumatology Biologics Register (BSRBR) for a maximum of 10 years. Doses of ETN and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity. Participants were eligible to receive any other therapy instead of ETN, as per investigator’s discretion and the doses of these were not controlled in the follow-up.

group.title: nbDMARDs
group.description: Biological naive participants with active RA who received non-biologic disease modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (nbDMARDs) in doses as per approved product label or SmPC were observed using the data in BSRBR for a maximum of 8.75 years. Doses of nbDMARDs and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count (DAS28) at Year 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5
measure.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity.
measure.population: FAS included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of 1 consultant follow-up after baseline registration. N (number of participants analyzed): participants evaluable for this measure, n: participants evaluable for specified time-points for each treatment arm, respectively.

analysis.groups_desc: Change at Year 1: analysis was performed with Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) using the General Linear Model (GLM) method applying age, gender, baseline DAS28, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, and baseline methotrexate as covariates.
Change at Year 2: analysis was performed with ANCOVA using the GLM method applying age, gender, baseline DAS28, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, and baseline methotrexate as covariates.
Change at Year 3: analysis was performed with ANCOVA using the GLM method applying age, gender, baseline DAS28, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, and baseline methotrexate as covariates.
Change at Year 4: analysis was performed with ANCOVA using the GLM method applying age, gender, baseline DAS28, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, and baseline methotrexate as covariates.
Change at Year 5: analysis was performed with ANCOVA using the GLM method applying age, gender, baseline DAS28, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, and baseline methotrexate as covariates.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Remission and Low Disease Activity as Assessed by Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count (DAS28)
outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of 1 consultant follow-up after baseline registration. N (number of participants analyzed): participants evaluable for this measure, n: participants evaluable for specified time-points for each treatment arm, respectively.

group.title: Etanercept
group.description: Participants with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who received etanercept (ETN, as their first biological drug) in doses as per approved product label or summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed using the data in British Society for Rheumatology Biologics Register (BSRBR) for a maximum of 10 years. Doses of ETN and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity. Participants were eligible to receive any other therapy instead of ETN, as per investigator’s discretion and the doses of these were not controlled in the follow-up.

group.description: Biological naive participants with active RA who received non-biologic disease modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (nbDMARDs) in doses as per approved product label or SmPC were observed using the data in BSRBR for a maximum of 8.75 years. Doses of nbDMARDs and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Remission and Low Disease Activity as Assessed by Disease Activity Score Based on 28-Joints Count (DAS28)
measure.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity.
measure.population: FAS included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of 1 consultant follow-up after baseline registration. N (number of participants analyzed): participants evaluable for this measure, n: participants evaluable for specified time-points for each treatment arm, respectively.

outcome.title: Time to Remission
outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity. Time to achieve remission was calculated by Kaplan-Meier survival analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to last follow-up, assessed every 6 month for first 3 years and thereafter annually up to 10 years
outcome.population: FAS population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration.

group.title: Etanercept
group.description: Participants with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who received etanercept (ETN, as their first biological drug) in doses as per approved product label or summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed using the data in British Society for Rheumatology Biologics Register (BSRBR) for a maximum of 10 years. Doses of ETN and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity. Participants were eligible to receive any other therapy instead of ETN, as per investigator’s discretion and the doses of these were not controlled in the follow-up.

group.title: nbDMARDs
group.description: Biological naive participants with active RA who received non-biologic disease modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (nbDMARDs) in doses as per approved product label or SmPC were observed using the data in BSRBR for a maximum of 8.75 years. Doses of nbDMARDs and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

measure.title: Time to Remission
measure.description: DAS28 calculated from SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the serological markers of inflammation (ESR [millimeter per hour] or CRP [milligram per liter]) and patient's general health assessment (recorded on a VAS scale of 0 mm-100 mm). DAS28 <=1.6 = remission, DAS28 <=2.4 = low disease activity, DAS28 >=3.2 to 5.1 = moderate disease activity, DAS28 >5.1 = severe disease activity. Time to achieve remission was calculated by Kaplan-Meier survival analysis.
measure.population: FAS population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration.

measurement_list.measurement: Median time to remission could not be calculated as fewer than 50% of participants had achieved remission during the follow up period.
Median time to remission could not be calculated as fewer than 50% of participants had achieved remission during the follow up period.

outcome.title: Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score at Baseline
outcome.description: HAQ: self-reported, valid assessment of functional disability in rheumatoid arthritis. Assessed based on ability of participants to perform daily activities in 8 categories: dressing, arising, eating, walking, reaching, gripping, hygiene, and carrying out daily activities. HAQ score range: 0-3: without any difficulty=0, with some difficulty=1, with much difficulty=2, unable to do=3. HAQ total scores expressed as overall mean score with range 0-3: 0-0.25=normal functioning; 0.25-0.5=mild functional limitation; 0.5-1=moderate functional limitation; more than 1=significant functional limitation.
outcome.population: FAS population included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of one consultant follow-up after baseline registration.

group.description: Participants with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who received etanercept (ETN, as their first biological drug) in doses as per approved product label or summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed using the data in British Society for Rheumatology Biologics Register (BSRBR) for a maximum of 10 years. Doses of ETN and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity. Participants were eligible to receive any other therapy instead of ETN, as per investigator’s discretion and the doses of these were not controlled in the follow-up.

measure.description: HAQ: self-reported, valid assessment of functional disability in rheumatoid arthritis. Assessed based on ability of participants to perform daily activities in 8 categories: dressing, arising, eating, walking, reaching, gripping, hygiene, and carrying out daily activities. HAQ score range: 0-3: without any difficulty=0, with some difficulty=1, with much difficulty=2, unable to do=3. analysis.groups_desc: Change at Year 1: analysis was performed with ANCOVA using the GLM method applying age, gender, baseline HAQ, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, and baseline methotrexate as covariates.
Change at Year 2: analysis was performed with ANCOVA using the GLM method applying age, gender, baseline HAQ, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, and baseline methotrexate as covariates.
Change at Year 3: analysis was performed with ANCOVA using the GLM method applying age, gender, baseline HAQ, previous non-RA drugs, baseline steroid, and baseline methotrexate as covariates.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Remission Based on Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score
outcome.description: HAQ: self-reported, valid assessment of functional disability in rheumatoid arthritis. Assessed based on ability of participants to perform daily activities in 8 categories: dressing, arising, eating, walking, reaching, gripping, hygiene, and carrying out daily activities. HAQ score range: 0-3: without any difficulty=0, with some difficulty=1, with much difficulty=2, unable to do=3. HAQ total scores expressed as overall mean score with range 0-3. Participants who had HAQ total score <=0.5 were considered in remission state.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants treated with ETN or nbDMARDs who had a physician diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and a minimum of 1 consultant follow-up after baseline registration. N (number of participants analyzed): participants evaluable for this measure, n: participants evaluable for specified time-points for each treatment arm, respectively.

outcome.title: Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Score 6 Months Prior to And 6 Months Post-Switching Etanercept
outcome.description: HAQ: self-reported, valid assessment of functional disability in rheumatoid arthritis. Assessed based on ability of participants to perform daily activities in 8 categories: dressing, arising, eating, walking, reaching, gripping, hygiene, and carrying out daily activities. HAQ score range: 0-3: without any difficulty=0, with some difficulty=1, with much difficulty=2, unable to do=3. HAQ total scores expressed as overall mean score with range 0-3: 0-0.25=normal functioning; 0.25-0.5=mild functional limitation; 0.5-1=moderate functional limitation; more than 1=significant functional limitation.
outcome.time_frame: 6 months prior to and 6 months post switching etanercept
outcome.population: FAS population. Here “N” (number of participants analyzed): participants evaluable for this measure, “n”: participants evaluable for specified time-points. Only participants treated with ETN were to be analyzed for this outcome measure.

Doses of ETN and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity. Participants were eligible to receive any other therapy instead of ETN, as per investigator’s discretion and the doses of these were not controlled in the follow-up.

reported_events.desc: Due to retrospective nature of the study, it was difficult to capture non serious adverse events (Non-SAEs) and only serious adverse events (SAEs) were captured.

group.title: Etanercept
group.description: Participants with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) who received etanercept (ETN, as their first biological drug) in doses as per approved product label or summary of product characteristics (SmPC) were observed using the data in British Society for Rheumatology Biologics Register (BSRBR) for a maximum of 10 years. Doses of ETN and any concomitant medication could be adjusted according to medical and therapeutic necessity. Participants were eligible to receive any other therapy instead of ETN, as per investigator’s discretion and the doses of these were not controlled in the follow-up.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
